reviews.text: I moved to this hotel for three nights, at a very last-minute notice after running into some unpleasant experiences at the Shinjuku Prince Hotel. The reservation was made hurriedly by my business associate, but the hotel staff were more than ready to receive me when I arrived to check in that evening.
reviews.title: Clean, spacious rooms with a homely feel

reviews.text: This hotel is located at the top of a hill, and it is not easy to locate the shuttle bus if you do not know where it stops. I was unable to find the shuttle bus stop at the Shinagawa Station, so I trudged my way uphill with my luggage and belongings. If you are anything short of being very fit, this can be a very tiring task.
reviews.title: Train station convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at this hotel was very good. The Grand Prince Hotel Takanawa actually shares its immediate area with two other hotels in the Prince group of hotels, namely the New Takanawa and Sakura Tower. It can be confusing to figure out which entrance was which if you have never been here, and I ended up at the New Takanawa instead. However, the hotel staff were very nice, and even had a bellhop help me with my luggage and direct me to the correct hotel. These three hotels share a common, but very large Japanese garden, which is a must-see if you stay here.
reviews.title: Really nice room and grounds

reviews.text: My room at this hotel was large with a high ceiling, and included two twin beds, a large sofa and desk. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was spotless. A slated wooden door separated the main entrance/closet/bathroom area from the rest of the room, which gave it an almost suite-like feel. The furnishings were rather old and dated, but I appreciated the space that this room offered, a rare treat when it comes to Tokyo hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: During my first two nights here I ran into some problems with the free Internet connection, and was unable to log on to do my work. However, the toll-free tech support was very helpful, and spoke excellent English. I was eventually able to solve my problem.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expedia photo is of a upgraded room but the lower cost booking is for a basic older room. At the hotel we upgraded to a more modern room. Cost of upgrade was moderate. Modern, spacious and comfortable on the 9th flr. with terrific views over Tokyo. Staff were very helpful (as they are in all Japanese hotels I've stayed in) and there is a convenient convenience store on the ground flr. A short uphill walk from the station and a shuttle bus is also available. It was Winter and snowing so we caught a taxi for about AUD$8.00.
reviews.title: Elegant and comfortable

reviews.text: I moved from the East Tower of the Prince Hotel where I stayed for work to this hotel on Feb 9th and what a surprise! The first things I noticed was the sense of space and tranquility. The foyer is very large and spacious and there are staff everywhere to make sure that you are OK. Check-in is also friendly and swift and you are provided with a lot of information about the many features of this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent! Would return in a heart beat!

reviews.text: When I went to my room I could not believe how large it was and everything else about it. My room overlooked an aspect of the city of Tokyo including Tokyo Tower - it was fabulous. The bathroom was also large and was well equiped with everything you could want. There is free internet and a range of local and cabel TV stations.
reviews.title: Great location, quiet surroundings, a good hotel.

reviews.text: This hotel offers a number of restaurants, a nice wine bar, a true cigar bar and a lovely tea/coffee lounge that has huge glass windows overlooking a very impressive Japanese garden and mini lake. I liked the tempura restaurant the best but there is so much to choose from at this hotel. The small lake is filled with beautiful coloured fish and the garden also has a tradition Japanese Tea House which is open for some parts of the day. The gardens are tranquil and so beautifully and it is great to be able to walk around outside a hotel.
reviews.title: Great size room

reviews.text: As others have mentioned the hotel is on top of a hill but the regular free shuttle service does not make this a problem also, the walk down to Shinagawa area or station is not difficult. A friend of mine recommended this hotel and I am very happy I took his advice and stayed here! I would return any time I am in Tokyo!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, both business and pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in January 2012 for four nights.The rooms were very large, particularly for Japan and overlooked the beautiful Japanese gardens. This area of the complex is so quiet for a central Tokyo hotel, and yet the Shinagawa Station is only a five minute walk away.While the rooms were not luxurious, they were furnished quite stylishly.It was bonus having a full size desk to put the laptop,newspapers, maps etc., on.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will stay here again and would suggest the Delux Garden Rooms for that little bit extra comfort.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great value hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent value hotel in Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights. Hotel has very good location five minutes walk to Shinagawa Station.
reviews.title: Convenient clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Price is good compare to other hotels in Tokyo and also the room is bigger than Japannesse standard. If you are in Japan in between March and April you can enjoy Sakura trees in the hotel garden. Although staff is very helpfull there is not enough English in the room so it is better to ask how to use remote control in the front desk. No free internet connection.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Wonderful Garden

reviews.text: Look beyond the fact that this hotel is a little dated in decor and its a great, affordable option in a very expensive city. Positioned right next door to Shinagawa Train Station, this is the perfect place to reach most areas of Central Tokyo. It is also within easy reach of Haneda Airport, by both Door to Door Limosine Bus (very cheap), or on the train link. The development is made up of a number of hotels, all surrounding a beautiful Japanese Garden - the perfect place to escape the city, for a bit of peace, quiet (and culture). Essentially the hotels are all aimed at the group and meetings market - but perfect also for individual travellers. The rooms are spacious with good facilities. My only complaint is that the internet connection is not WiFi (but it is complimentary, albeit a wired connection). Breakfast is extensive and adequate - with both Japanese and Western options. The service is first class throughout - attentive and very friendly. This is a great option for both business and leisure travellers.
reviews.title: Great service & prime location, if a little dated

reviews.text: I spent a week at the Grand Prince Hotel Takanawa in the beginning of May and was very pleased with my stay. The room was tiny, miniscule to be exact, but it was very clean and comfortable and I really didn't spend a lot of time sitting around. The bathroom was also small, but the water was always piping hot which was great. The hotel staff were very helpful, arranging several sight seeing trips and my airport drop off which was a 2:00 a.m.!!!! I had dinner in the Steak house which adjoins the hotel and it was shockingly expensive, but absolutely marvelous! Kobie beef cooked right at my table so that I felt like royalty and it was worth every penny. I also had dinner in the French restaurant and that was fabulous as well! The hotel grounds are simply stunning and it was delightful to sit by the pool that was filled with Koi and read. The hotel is located up the hill from the very convenient Shinagawa station and the stores and restaurants by the station were also well stocked and interesting. I loved Japan and plan to visit again and would stay at the hotel as well.
reviews.title: A quiet oasis in hectic Tokyo

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times while on business in Tokyo. The rooms may not be the most modern, by Marriott or Hilton standards, but they are clean and quite nice. The are on the small side, as this is Japan after all. The Grand Prince Takanawa is a very traditional Japanese hotel. The service is extremely good, the restaurants are very good and the Japanese garden in the rear of the hotel is the nicest feature of this beautiful property. I have come to enjoy very peaceful morning walks in the spacious garden before business starts for the day. This kind of sanctuary in the heart of Tokyo is incredibly unusual and a real treat. If you like older (probably built in the 60s), more traditional hotels you won't be disappointed. If you're a chain/points guy that prefers upscale US hotels like Hyatt, Westin, Hilton, Marriott then this probably isn't for you. I'm an American businessman who likes to stay at and eat the local fare when traveling in Japan.
reviews.title: Grand Prince Hotel Takanawa--a real treat

reviews.text: Most hotel rooms in tokyo are usually small by international standards. This hotel, though located a bit further from the main road and Shinagawa station, has spacious rooms and quiet location. Staff are genuinely helpful and speaks excellent english, useful for non japanese speaking tourists/businessmen. Several restaurants with the steak house (opened since 1969) and located in a quaint buiilding beside the hotel complex looks promising although it was under minor renovation and we did not have enough time to try it as well.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms, located on a hilltop overlooking Shinagawa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in Shinagawa, a short train ride from Shibuya, Shinjuku and many other interesting places in Tokyo, we stayed here for three nights in May 2012. Ask for a room overlooking the gardens. The room was comfortable and clean although the bathroom is quite small. Breakfast at the Patio in the hotel was great, with a mix of western and Japanese offerings - try the Japanese breakfast items - they're great. The hotel staff are very helpful and there's a frequent courtesy bus to Shinagawa station. If you like walking, the station is only about 10 minutes away on foot. Would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant for a Tokyo stay
